comment: Excellent professor, extremely helpful, and cares about students progress. Martin helps students to expand their efforts by helping get funding for conferences, and materials via university creative activity awards

Prof. Martin-Malikian worked diligently to inform us, was there to guide us through a new academic frontier, and created a R.E.A.L., Remote Electronic Architecture Lab. Our entire thesis class would never have been able to transition to online studio without the kindness, the calm, the support, and the mentoring that she gave to thesis students.

Thank you Professor Martin! Youve been an integral part to our success during thesis studio and go above and beyond to accommodate the students success. I believe her caring collaborative nature and willingness to go an extra mile benefited aall the students.

Professor Martin is an exceptional professor. She is knowledgeable, a good communicator, and a very fair grader. You really can't ask for more. She is truly invested in teaching and it shows. Do not miss the opportunity to take her.

For thesis, Martin's humorous use of the Socratic method encourages students to think for themselves. What distinguishes her is that she always finds ways to engage students in what theyre learning by bringing practical skills into the classroom without losing the poetry of construction. She can help you work more efficiently.

As thesis coordinator, Prof. Martin works hard for the students bringing in experts, alumni and practicing architects to provide feedback to students developing their thesis ideas. Her energy can be intoxicating and she gets other faculty engaged. She thinks big and expects that of students as well. Not sure what the school would do without her!!!
Adored by students. Highly recommended. She goes out of her way to help students with their projects, has great ideas and gives good feedback.

Prof. Martin is one of those rare professors who enjoys architecture to such an extent that she wants her students to have that same passion. She is an interesting, fast-paced lecturer but accessible for any problems or questions that you have. Tests count, but she gives students who need it extra credit assignments.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pleasant and polite to students. In studio, Doesn't focus on grades rather her goal is for you to gain understanding and produce a well thought out, creative project. Super organized. Would highly recommend & take again!

Prof. Martin is the thesis coordinator and lays the foundation for our final studio where students research and design independent projects. She is intense, but present unlike many of the other professors at school. Martin cares and helps you build a strong final project to get a job at a good firm or prepare for grad school. Highly recommend.

Great teacher. Nice and polite. She taught at a good speed and did not overpower my other classes so I felt like I could actually learn the content, while feeling secure about my knowledge of the subject matter. Covers much more than the other 2-classes offered, but she schedules a lab-week that was fun and added to what we learned.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Martin is pretty cool, definitely laidback, but accessible. I would totally recommend her for studio. She is not a difficult teacher by any means, but she is serious when it comes to an understanding ofdesign process and will push you until it hurts. If you see a spot open for any of her classes, hurry up and take it because it won't be there long.

Prof. Martin's Env-Tech I is by far harder & more comprehensive, but you learn more. She supplements final grading w/what she refers to as 'learning-by-observation'. Our class made the same object in 3-materials: wood, concrete+polymer. Bringing in the expertise from our FabLab, the process was fascinating & end product was so much fun. Recommend!!

Professor Martin is committed to helping her students improve in their architectural skills. She puts a lot of emphasis on process and expects her students to deliver strong work. If your willing to put in the time and dedication then the results will show, although it can be intense balancing concept and result. Plan on making lots of models. Fun!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Fall semester 3rd year studio has a high learning curve and the most challenging course I've taken so far. Martin cares about the students and pushes you to grow. In retrospect, I enjoyed the studio and was proud of my project, but at times, I was struggling. Showing your thought process is key. She loves seeing sections and models.

Martin is cool---she really cares about the students and exposes you to a variety of viewpoints. Open minded to your ideas and likes to get students out of the institutional four walls and into the 'city'.  Quality of representation and work ethic important. If you see a spot open for any of her classes, grab it bc it won't be there for long.

Professor Martin teaches urban design and usually starts with a conceptual/ theoretical view by using not only articles but movies to set the tone of the the studio and get the class 'thinking'. Representation is important, along with a combination of digital / analogue  making.  She often takes students on field trips as a way to understand place

Professor Martin works hard for the students. As coordinator of thesis, she recently organized a 3-Minute Thesis and worked with students to get them up to speed. She has a cheerful manner, really cares about students and treats everyone the same. Make sure you understand early topics since the material builds upon itself.
One of the most competitive and challenging studios I've ever taken. Everyone, myself included, did some of the best work we've even done. Highly recommend.

Fun, easy-going with a focused intensity that sometimes intimidates students. If you take her 3rd year studio, you will learn a lot that makes sense years later. She's very intuitive and appreciates study models and graphic communication. Be prepared to produce a lot. She takes her studio on-the-road alot an getting out of Atlanta for projects.

Understandable, down to earth, and respectable. Martin's been teaching thesis prep the longest and has had her thesis published as Pamphlet Architecture 16! Highly recommend. Has good background and isn't as big headed as arch professors can be.

Liz makes the first environmental tech class interesting and exposes you to interesting ways materials can be used. Materials & Methods class is hands-on, informative with field trips. She makes it fun without giving up the technical know-how . Her tests are hard, but she's clear on what to study.

Amazing amounts of usefull knowledge, but can be very hard to decifer what she is wanting at times. She wants you to find your own voice. Lots of knowledge, great fun, and willing to help if asked. Must be able to manage your own time

Prof. Martin taught us that architecture is a field that goes beyond the walls of a building and as architects our role in society can go beyond design. We can become catalysts of change. She always pushed me to new limits, never settling for the easily understood or falling back on complacency. Plus, she's very approachable.

Martin puts her students first even if it means challegning the school's traditional parameters. This semster our studio project is in New Orleans and we had an incredible eye-opening tour of the city. Challenging studio combining functional problem-solving w/design integrity. Conceptual clarity as important as the building design.

Liz is a remarkable teacher as she takes a strong interest in developing her students both academically and personally. A wonderful mentor who is extremely resourceful, retains and shares valuable information, and works adamantly on bridging the gap of academia and real world practice.Â

Professor Martin's classes always fill up quickly and students respect her even though she's one of the hardest graders at school. You'll work hard for a B in studio, but you will learn a lot abut design process, and incredible library of precedent that she easily pulls out of thin air. She helps students find their own design voice which is a plus

Liz brings active social discourse into studio and makes a point of exposes students to outside culture. Our studio went on a week long road trip to Marfa, TX and the experience in-and-of itself was eye-opening and an incredible learning experience. On of the best studios this year.
class is always fun, liz not only is one of the few profs that has balls to think what she thinks and say what she says, but she takes things outside the "usual" studio discourse.
Very energetic, fun prof.
